Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Standard flow: RO -> CA -> RI -> PI -> QC -> PO -> GSL -> D. Parallel/Alternative flows usually involve IC and RP.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Most activities in a standard order happen exactly once. Receive Order: 1 Check Availability: 1 Reserve Items: 1 Pick Items: 1 Quality Check: 1 Pack Order: 1 Generate Shipping Label: 1 Dispatch: 1 Invoice Customer: 1 Record Payment: 1

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Hypothesis 1: PO -> GSL -> D -> IC -> RP. Hypothesis 2: PO -> IC -> RP -> GSL -> D. Hypothesis 3: PO -> GSL -> IC -> RP -> D.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Sequence: RO -> CA -> RI -> PI -> QC -> PO -> GSL -> D -> IC -> RP Directly Follows: (RO, CA), (CA, RI), (RI, PI), (PI, QC), (QC, PO), (PO, GSL), (GSL, D), (D, IC), (IC, RP)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: always_before: (CA, RO) (RI, CA) (PI, RI) (QC, PI) (PO, QC) (GSL, PO) (D, GSL) (IC, D) (RP, IC)

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: always_after: (RO, CA) (CA, RI) (RI, PI) (PI, QC) (QC, PO) (PO, GSL) (GSL, D) (D, IC) (IC, RP)

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: equivalence: Since everyone is 1, everyone is equivalent to everyone. However, select the functional pairs: (RO, D), (GSL, D), (IC, RP)

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Sanity Check: Does (RO, CA) in always_after and (CA, RO) in always_before mean strict sequence? Combining them defines precedence order.

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: Is there any ambiguity in the order? Generate Shipping Label... Dispatch. Invoice Customer... Record Payment. Assume the sequence PO -> GSL -> D -> IC -> RP.
